TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content: When you expect nasa's next big announcement to be that they found traces of kethane on the moon
...you have more than two satellites orbiting every planet and it's moon(s).
When you start researching the inner workings of the KSP drag model so you can squeeze one more time around Kerbin out of your spaceplane.

You know you've played too much KSP when pigs fly.

(i.e. there's NO SUCH THING as too much KSP!)
When your computer lags every time you load up your ship list...
When you hear "100 kilometers per second of dV" and let your jaw drop.

When you look at the moon and the KSP themesong starts playing in your head.

(yes, that happened to me yesterday)

You know you've been playing too much KSP when you know all the sizes and orientations of the structural wing parts. You know what I'm talking about.

- - - Updated - - -

When you watch the Martian and compare Matt Damon to Jeb after you marooned him on Duna. You then start thinking of hollywood flaws with space travel, at least starting with the centrifuge on the Hermes not going fast enough to create 1G

Pretty

You know you've played too much KSP when pigs fly.

(i.e. there's NO SUCH THING as too much KSP!)

Someone made a flying pig... in KSP! Now what? LOL!

JR
... When you're watching the Falcon 9 RTF and landing on live webcast and try to use the arrow keys to rotate the camera angle...
When you accidentally say "munar eclipse" instead of "lunar eclipse."

When you're visiting the campus where your father studied 30 years ago and ask "What's that building?" and get "That's the administration building" as an answer, proceeded by you imagining 4 kerbals sitting inside a room inside the building, each one representing a certain part of the campus, discussing their strategies.

 

True story.

When you find yourself right-click dragging to try to spin the camera in a YouTube video.

I do that a lot.
When you accidentally put your phone in orbit mode instead of airplane mode.

Just now, cubinator said:

When you accidentally put your phone in orbit mode instead of airplane mode.

Ha! And I thought this thread had lost it's magic!

When you constantly say "Mun" or "Munar" instead of "Moon" or "Lunar".

When you look for timewarp, F5, and F9 in real life. 

When you are horrified by the amount of people that have no clue about what Space is actually like IRL.

When you can't take any sci-fi Space movie/book/comic seriously. 

When you look at IRL Spacecraft and think "why did they need so much Delta-V..." before remembering orbital velocity is higher IRL than in KSP due to the difference in size between Kerbin and Earth.
Jeb ?
when your thinking about NASA and you forget that earth has only one moon...

When I say mun landing or if I say instead of "comet" I say "minmus" also if I say kerbol and not the sun. Also if I say intakeair and not air(yes I've done that in the following context "does the X-15 use intakeair or oxidizer" in the air and space museum).
When you're discussing Episode VII with your kids and you can't stop calling him "Tylo Ren".
When every time you see Jeb Bush, you picture a smiling green face.

When you constantly thing 'more' is spelled wrong.

When you spell 'or' as 'ore'

The ship was positioned on a bugged spot of the launchpad.  Upon physics load, it went into the Kraken Dance.  The tail fins got slung off and destroyed several unimportant facilities in the vicinity with minimal loss of life.  Then the whole rocket just fell apart.
When you're driving, and you like the feeling when a new stage kicks in...
When you seriously start thinking of making a working NavBall for your desk.
